parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Contracted from Epaphroditos; Epaphras, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From sun and doulos; a co-slave, i.e. Servitor or ministrant of the same master.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
